item.title: Doctor Who season 12: Jodie Whittaker confirms she will return as the Time Lord - The Independent
item.description:
Doctor Who season 12: Jodie Whittaker confirms she will return as the Time Lord  The Independent

Jodie Whittaker is set to go on more adventures aboard the Tardis. The Doctor Who star has confirmed she will return as the Time Lord in season 12 of the BCC's iconic sci-fi series. "I really can’t wait to step back in and get to work again," Whittaker told The Hollywood Reporter. "It’s such an incredible role. It's been an extraordinary journey so far and I'm not quite ready to hand it over yet." It was announced in July 2017 that Whittaker had been picked as the 13th Doctor, succeeding to Peter Capaldi. The casting decision was met with excitement as Whittaker was the first woman to ever ...

item.title: Narcos: Mexico season 2: Netflix renews Diego Luna and Michael Peña series - The Independent
item.description:
Narcos: Mexico season 2: Netflix renews Diego Luna and Michael Peña series  The Independent

Netflix has renewed Narcos: Mexico for a second season. The sequel series – set in the 1980s – stars Diego Luna and Michael Peña as the Mexican drug-lord Félix Gallardo and DEA agent Kiki Camarena, respectively. The story sees Kiki garner intelligence on Félix, eventually becoming more entangled in his mission and a tragic chain of events unfolding. Both actors will assumably return for the second series, which itself will be the fifth overall season of Narcos. The first three revolved around the kingpin Pablo Escobar and the aftermath of his death, taking place primarily in Columbia. The 2...

item.title: Daredevil cancelled by Netflix despite being one of the most streamed shows across America - The Independent
item.description:
Daredevil cancelled by Netflix despite being one of the most streamed shows across America  The Independent

Netflix has begun cancelling all their Marvel content, beginning with Iron Fist and recently culminating in Daredevil. The latter came as a particular surprise, as the Charlie Cox-led series has picked up rave reviews and seemingly had a large fan-base. According to the latest numbers from Parrot Analytics, as published by Deadline, the series was indeed hugely popular with streamers: the company claims Daredevil was the fourth most-demanded show among all digital original programmes in the US last week. The three series that beat the superhero show were Narcos, The Chilling Adventures of S...

item.title: Friends: Netflix confirms Friends will stay on US and UK version of streaming service until 2020 - The Independent
item.description:
Friends: Netflix confirms Friends will stay on US and UK version of streaming service until 2020  The Independent

Netflix has confirmed that the world's most beloved sitcom is remaining on the streaming service. Fans of Friends – who are currently able to watch all 10 seasons on Netflix – were worried that their supply would get cut off after a message on the streamer's website made it look like the entire show could soon be taken down. Netflix's homepage stated on Monday morning that Friends would be available only until 1 January 2019, implying that all 236 episodes would disappear come the new year. Both the UK and US versions of Netflix have now assuaged subscribers' fears, confirming that Friends ...

item.title: Doctor Who actors reject claims the show has become too politically correct - The Independent
item.description:
Doctor Who actors reject claims the show has become too politically correct  The Independent

The cast of Doctor Who have laughed off suggestions that the iconic science fiction show has become too politically correct. Mandip Gill and Tosin Cole – who play Yaz and Ryan alongside Jodie Whittaker’s Doctor – have rejected the idea the series has become overly politicised and believe it is an “entertaining reminder” of important issues. Speaking in Radio Times, the pair said that the show can provoke “extreme opinions” in some viewers who comment online. In being too politically correct, Gill said: “It makes me laugh, because having the words ‘too’ and ‘correct’ in the same sentence is ...

item.title: Stranger Things season 3: Everything we know so far from cast and plot to spoilers - The Independent
item.description:
Stranger Things season 3: Everything we know so far from cast and plot to spoilers  The Independent

It feels like we’ve been waiting forever for a return to Hawkins, Indiana. Unfortunately, there’s still longer to wait, as season three of Stranger Things will debut outside of its usual Halloween slot. However, in return, expect new characters, new thrills, a major new location, and some of the biggest special effects yet. Here’s everything you need to know. What year does it take place? Season three will take place in the summer of 1985, a little bit less than a year since the events of season 2, which took place in October 1984. As has now become standard with the series, expect referenc...

item.title: Daredevil cancelled: Cast ‘heartbroken’ after Netflix ends Marvel series - The Independent
item.description:
Daredevil cancelled: Cast ‘heartbroken’ after Netflix ends Marvel series  The Independent

Netflix has cancelled Daredevil after three seasons, leaving the cast “heartbroken and surprised”. The streaming service won’t be bringing its original Marvel series back for a fourth season, confirming in a statement: “Although it’s painful for the fans, we feel it best to close this chapter on a high note”. Fans may be surprised but it’s the cast who are truly devastated, with many expressing difficulties processing the news despite the cancellation of Iron Fist and Luke Cage. Rahul Nadeem star Jay Ali wrote: “So Sad to hear the end of @Daredevil. I was so lucky and fortunate to be a part...

item.title: Netflix TV shows: The 25 best series to watch in the UK - The Independent
item.description:
Netflix TV shows: The 25 best series to watch in the UK  The Independent

Netflix's televised revolution began in earnest in February 2013, when the machiavellian political schemer Frank Underwood looked straight into the camera and casually snapped a dog’s neck. It was the first episode of House of Cards – a $100 million TV series that would only be available on the Internet. The show represented a huge risk for the streaming service as it sought to make the leap from tech start-up to entertainment industry goliath. Five years on and the gamble has paid off. Netflix was a major winner at the Emmys, its haul of 23 awards attesting to its power-player status. And ...

item.title: Luther season 5 trailer: Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson return in brutal promo - The Independent
item.description:
Luther season 5 trailer: Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson return in brutal promo  The Independent

The trailer for the forthcoming fifth series of Luther has been released ahead of its premiere this Christmas. It was announced in June 2017 that series co-creator Neil Cross had signed up Idris Elba to return as the grizzled detective for four brand new episodes of the crime series following its apparent “climax” in 2015. But sure enough, DCI Luther is back in a trailer that’s capped with a blink-and-you’ll-miss-it cameo from none other than Ruth Wilson’s fan favourite, Alice Morgan, which you can watch below. Other returning cast members include Dermot Crowley, Michael Smiley and Patrick ...

item.title: BBC Christmas schedule revealed: From Watership Down, The ABC Murders, Luther season 5 to Les Misérables - The Independent
item.description:
BBC Christmas schedule revealed: From Watership Down, The ABC Murders, Luther season 5 to Les Misérables  The Independent

The BBC has unveiled their Christmas TV schedule for 2018, revealing a line-up that features iconic detectives, animated rabbits, and 19th century classics. John Malkovich’s Poirot leads the way, the actor starring as the iconic character alongside Harry Potter’s Rupert Grint in an adaptation of Agatha Christie’s The ABC Murders. A star-studded version of Watership Down – featuring the voices of James McAvoy, Nicolas Hoult, John Boyega, Olivia Coleman, Ben Kingsley, Gemma Arterton, and Peter Capaldi – will also debut on BBC One, as will a six-part version of Les Misérables starring Dominic ...

item.title: Dynasties: BBC crew responsible for calling vets on poisoned lion cub - The Independent
item.description:
Dynasties: BBC crew responsible for calling vets on poisoned lion cub  The Independent

The third episode of David Attenborough's latest series Dynasties was a heartbreaking look at how humans are negatively affecting the lives of lions. Viewers witnessed a pride being poisoned by neighbouring farmers after some bait was laced with poison. A group of vets were soon on scene, hoping to save a young lion cub as he struggled to keep up with the others. Reports have since revealed that the medical crew who attempted to help the cub were alerted by the BBC crew filming th pride. The Mara Mobile Veterinary Unit filed an incident report, which notes the lions “were seen during the mo...

item.title: Bodyguard actor Richard Madden confirms talks for season 2 are happening - The Independent
item.description:
Bodyguard actor Richard Madden confirms talks for season 2 are happening  The Independent

Following the astronomical success of Bodyguard, talks of a sequel were inevitable. Richard Madden – who played the eponymous bodyguard in the series – has since confirmed that talks with showrunner Jed Mercurio about a follow-up are taking place. “I’m having a conversation with him (Mercurio) in about 10 days or something, when I’m back in the country, and we are just going to chat through some ideas,” he said. “We never intended to make another one and I don’t know, I’m excited to see what he’s got, especially because David (Budd, his character) had quite a busy couple of months. “So what...

item.title: Luther season 5: New clip shows how much trouble Idris Elba's detective is in - The Independent
item.description:
Luther season 5: New clip shows how much trouble Idris Elba's detective is in  The Independent

The BBC has released a new clip from the upcoming series 5 of Luther. The scene sees Idris Elba‘s grizzled detective being interrogated by George, as he demands Luther reveals the location of his son Alistair, who appears to have been kidnapped. It was announced in June 2017 that series co-creator Neil Cross had signed up Elba to return for four brand new episodes of the crime series. The character was last seen on screen in 2015. - Read more Idris Elba returns as Luther in new teaser trailer While plot details remain sparse, the first look at the series came with one bold warning: “This wi...

item.title: Rick & Morty has more deaths per episode than any other show on streaming, report claims - The Independent
item.description:
Rick & Morty has more deaths per episode than any other show on streaming, report claims  The Independent

Rick and Morty has been named the deadliest TV show currently available on streaming. According to a study by BuzzBingo, the animated series outnumbers even The Walking Dead in its number of onscreen deaths, with an average of 26.1 deaths per episode. That equates to 808 deaths across its three seasons and 31 episodes. Westworld, however, is only just behind with 25.9 deaths per episode, while The Walking Dead averages 23.2. Read more - Dan Harmon deletes his Twitter after ‘distasteful’ video resurfaces - Rick and Morty creator announces 70 more episodes will be made - Rick and Morty creato...

item.title: Kelsey Grammer hopes to bring back old co-stars for Frasier reboot - The Independent
item.description:
Kelsey Grammer hopes to bring back old co-stars for Frasier reboot  The Independent

Whether the world really needs a Frasier reboot remains up for debate, but that has not stopped leading star Kelsey Grammer pursuing the idea. Speaking at the USC Comedy Festival alongside co-star David Hyde Pierce (Niles), the Emmy-winning actor told an audience thatno premise has yet been set in stone. “No, there’s been no premise that has come along that has the necessary fire,” Deadline reports Grammer saying. "A lot of us are quite committed to the concept that you would never try to redo what we once had.” Asked about whether Pierce and other co-stars would return, Grammer said: "In m...

item.title: Penny Dreadful is returning to TV - with new cast - The Independent
item.description:
Penny Dreadful is returning to TV - with new cast  The Independent

Penny Dreadful will return to Showtime for a revival series, two years after its dramatic conclusion. A new chapter called City of Angels will serve as “spiritual descendant” of the original three-season story set in Victorian-era London, says The Hollywood Reporter. The series will take place in Los Angeles in 1938 which, according to Showtime, is “a time and place deeply infused with Mexican-American folklore and social tension”. The conflict of the series will be rooted between characters connected to the deity Santa Muerte and others allied with the devil, using the supernatural set aga...

item.title: Javier Bardem revealed as highest-paid actor on TV - The Telegraph
item.description:
Javier Bardem revealed as highest-paid actor on TV  The Telegraph

Javier Bardem is the highest-paid star in TV, according to a Variety investigation. He will earn $1.2million for each episode of Amazon’s forthcoming series about Hernán Cortés. In joint second place on the list are Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston, who are each being paid $1.1m for their untitled morning show drama for Apple. The top 10 per episode salaries are: - $1.2m, Javier Bardem (untitled series, Amazon) - (=) $1.1m, Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston (untitled series, Apple) - (=) $1m, Elisabeth Moss (The Handmaid’s Tale, Hulu); Norman Reedus (The Walking Dead, AMC) - (=) ...

item.title: Highest-paid TV stars 2018: Salaries of the biggest names in US television revealed, from Reese Witherspoon to Javier Bardem - The Independent
item.description:
Highest-paid TV stars 2018: Salaries of the biggest names in US television revealed, from Reese Witherspoon to Javier Bardem  The Independent

The salaries of TV’s highest-paid actors have been revealed. Split into three categories – comedy, unscripted and drama – the new report comes from Variety and reveals just how much stars earn per episode. The highest-paid actor in a US drama is Javier Bardem who will earn $1.2m for his role in a forthcoming Amazon series based on “legendary conqueror” Hernan Cortes from Traffic writer, Steven Zaillian. Following close behind are Hollywood stars Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston who’ll each earn $1.1m per episode for their roles in a new series from Apple. Their co-star, Steve Carell, ...

item.title: BoJack Horseman renewed for season 6 by Netflix - The Independent
item.description:
BoJack Horseman renewed for season 6 by Netflix  The Independent

Netflix's best show about a depressed animated horse will return for another season. The streaming service has confirmed that a sixth season of BoJack Horseman, which follows the struggles of a washed up alcoholic actor, has been commissioned. A tweet from the BoJack Twitter page confirmed the news with a message reading: "Woooowwwwwwwwwwwwwww lets all forget about the fact that theres going to b a season 6 and focus on this inedible arrangement Netflix sent me just woww." woooowwwwwwwwwwwwwww lets all forget about the fact that theres going to b a season 6 and focus on this inedible arrang...

item.title: House of Cards: Netflix scraps Doug Stamper spinoff series - The Independent
item.description:
House of Cards: Netflix scraps Doug Stamper spinoff series  The Independent

Netflix has cancelled plans to make a House of Cards spinoff series focused on character Doug Stamper. The series was confirmed to be in the works at the streaming service after Kevin Spacey was fired following multiple allegations of sexual assault. However, actor Michael Kelly has confirmed the project will not proceed. “There was talk of a spinoff for a while, and we went well down the road on that. And I would’ve liked to have played him more, but when they decided not to do that, I was okay,” he told Variety. “I was really okay with it. I felt like I had done him justice, and it was an...

item.title: Legend of Zelda: Castlevania creator in talks to bring Nintendo classic to Netflix - The Independent
item.description:
Legend of Zelda: Castlevania creator in talks to bring Nintendo classic to Netflix  The Independent

Castlevania showrunner Adi Shankar has entered into talks with Netflix to produce a TV series based on the video-game series The Legend of Zelda. Shankar previously Tweeted he was “working with an iconic Japanese gaming company to adapt one of their iconic video game series into a series.” The Wrap has since confirmed that the producer hopes to bring the long-running Nintendo series to the streaming service. Netflix already produces Shankar’s Castlevania, an animated show based on the game of the same name, the second season of which was released on Friday (26 October). The 25 best TV shows...

item.title: The Walking Dead season 9 episode 4 sees Norman Reedus drop show's first F-word - The Independent
item.description:
The Walking Dead season 9 episode 4 sees Norman Reedus drop show's first F-word  The Independent

The Walking Dead just dropped its first ever F-word. Strict rules placed on the AMC series have meant it's had to censor the word “f*ck” from every episode in the past, however, guidelines were reportedly “relaxed” ahead of the show’s eighth season. meaning Rick Grimes (Andrew Lincoln) and the gang could use the expletive up to twice throughout a season. Despite this, The Walking Dead kept the word from the entirety of season eight – however, the show’s latest episode saw Daryl Dixon (Norman Reedus) utter the word in one of its more emotional moments. Major spoilers follow for episode four,...

item.title: Sarah Scott accuses actor Kip Pardue of sexually assaulting her during and after filming sex scene - The Independent
item.description:
Sarah Scott accuses actor Kip Pardue of sexually assaulting her during and after filming sex scene  The Independent

Sarah Scott has accused fellow actor Kip Pardue of masturbating in front of her after filming a sex scene, and accused SAG-AFTRA [Screen Actors Guild – American Federation of Television and Radio Artists] of failing to respond quickly to her claims. Scott, who has appeared in TV shows including True Blood and Castle, alleges that the incident involving Pardue happened on 16 May when they filmed a post-coital scene together for a pilot series called Mogulettes. She claims Pardue became aroused while they were under a bedsheet waiting for the scene to begin. He allegedly put her hand on his g...

item.title: Chilling Adventures of Sabrina review round-up: Critics hail ‘spooky as hell’ Netflix show - The Independent
item.description:
Chilling Adventures of Sabrina review round-up: Critics hail ‘spooky as hell’ Netflix show  The Independent

The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina has just arrived on Netflix bringing the Archie Comics character back to the small screen. This time around, Mad Men star Kiernan Shipka plays the eponymous teenage witch in an altogether darker show than the version starring Melissa Joan Hart in the 1990s. Critics have weighed in on the reboot – and it’s unanimous praise all round for the series which has been devised by Riverdale‘s Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa. Find out what they’re saying below. - Read more How Sabrina the Teenage Witch is symbolic of feminism through the ages Digital Spy If Riverdale occasio...

item.title: Another Life: what to know about Selma Blair's new Netflix series - The Telegraph
item.description:
Another Life: what to know about Selma Blair's new Netflix series  The Telegraph

Selma Blair received an outpouring of sympathy over the weekend after revealing she had been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. The actress made her name during the late Nineties and early Noughties with films such as Cruel Intentions and Guillermo Del Toro’s Hellboy films, but as Blair explained in her enlightening Instagram post, will be returning to the small screen with Netflix sci-fi drama series, Another Life. The news has caused interest to pique in the sci-fi drama; here’s what you need to know: Blair’s involvement in Another Life marks yet another instance of an actress who has ch...

item.title: The Crown season 3: Emerald Fennell cast as Camilla Parker Bowles - The Independent
item.description:
The Crown season 3: Emerald Fennell cast as Camilla Parker Bowles  The Independent

Netflix has confirmed who will play Camilla Parker Bowles in The Crown season three. Emerald Fennell will star as the Duchess of Cornwall in the Emmy Award-winning series that has recast its characters as it enters a new era. Fennell, who is best known for BBC series Call the Midwife, said: “I’m absolutely over the moon, and completely terrified, to be joining so many hugely talented people on The Crown. I absolutely love Camilla, and am very grateful that my teenage years have well prepared me for playing a chain-smoking serial snogger with a pudding bowl haircut.” - Read more The Crown ep...

item.title: Bodyguard finale was most watched drama tv episode since records began with 17m viewers - The Independent
item.description:
Bodyguard finale was most watched drama tv episode since records began with 17m viewers  The Independent

Despite the proliferation of streaming services, the summer of 2018 saw the nation brought together by three major televised events: the World Cup, Love Island and Bodyguard. All three have been record breaking (England vs Tunisia at the World Cup is the most-watched live event of the year so far; Love Island broke ITV2 viewership records), with the Bodyguard finale only now breaking another: most-watched episode of a drama since records began in 2002. According to the BBC, 17.1 million people across the UK watched the finale over the course of 28 days. The consolidated figure was calculate...

item.title: Daredevil season 4: Showrunner discusses whether possible in wake of Iron Fist and Luke Cage cancellation - The Independent
item.description:
Daredevil season 4: Showrunner discusses whether possible in wake of Iron Fist and Luke Cage cancellation  The Independent

With Netflix having cancelled both Iron Fist and Luke Cage within a week of each other, fans have begun to question the future of their fellow Defenders. Jessica Jones and The Punisher have already been renewed for their third and second seasons, respectively, but Daredevil has not had another run commissioned. Following the third season’s debut on the streaming service, showrunner Erik Oleson spoke to Entertainment Weekly about the current status of the show. “I can tell you that I’m very hopeful to go do a season four,” he told the publication. “There has not yet been any kind of an offic...

item.title: Orange Is the New Black to end with season 7 on Netflix - The Independent
item.description:
Orange Is the New Black to end with season 7 on Netflix  The Independent

One of Netflix's first original shows is officially drawing to a close. The streaming service has announced that prison series Orange Is the New Black, which stars Taylor Schilling and Laverne Cox, will end with its forthcoming seventh season. Responding to the news, creator Jenji Kohan said: “After seven seasons, it’s time to be released from prison. I will miss all the badass ladies of Litchfield and the incredible crew we’ve worked with. My heart is orange but fade to black.” Vice President of Original Content for Netflix Cindy Holland reflected on the series' legacy in a statement which...

item.title: Netflix's 3Q subscriber growth gets rave reviews on Wall St. - The Associated Press
item.description:
Netflix's 3Q subscriber growth gets rave reviews on Wall St.  The Associated Press

SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Netflix regained its stride with surprisingly strong subscriber growth in the third quarter, after an unexpected springtime stumble triggered fears that it was losing its allure. The video-streaming service added 7 million subscribers worldwide from July through September, far above the company's target of 5 million and exceeding analyst projections. Netflix fell well shy of its subscriber goals for the April-to-June period, raising fears that fiercer competition from Amazon, Hulu, HBO and other streaming services was siphoning away viewers. In a show of confidence, Net...

item.title: The Walking Dead: Andrew Lincoln is leaving season 8 sooner than expected - The Independent
item.description:
The Walking Dead: Andrew Lincoln is leaving season 8 sooner than expected  The Independent

The synopses for the next five episodes of The Walking Dead have been released – and it seems Andrew Lincoln is leaving the show sooner than expected. Which episode exactly will mark the departure of Rick Grimes remains to be seen, but AMC’s decision to release a synopsis for every episode bar the ninth season’s sixth outing hints that it could arrive as early as three weeks. The synopsis for episode 9x05 – titled “What Comes After” – reads: “Rick is forced to face the past as he struggles to maintain the safety of the communities and protect the future he and Carl envisioned.” - Read more ...

item.title: Streaming’s greatest hits: the best TV shows from Netflix and Amazon - The Guardian
item.description:
Streaming’s greatest hits: the best TV shows from Netflix and Amazon  The Guardian

Netflix and Amazon have invested billions of dollars in producing original content for their streaming platforms. Here are some of their most notable shows. Netflix House of Cards A remake of a British classic, the streaming site’s first original showed its competitors that it meant business. The accusations surrounding Kevin Spacey’s alleged behaviour on set saw him fired from the show and leave its final season – which starts on 2 November – in the hands of his co-star Robin Wright. Stranger Things The Duffer Brothers pastiche-athon was a massive sleeper hit for Netflix. Released in the s...

item.title: Roseanne Barr hits back at The Connors premiere, calling it 'grim and morbid' - The Independent
item.description:
Roseanne Barr hits back at The Connors premiere, calling it 'grim and morbid'  The Independent

The Conners’ family returned to television screens last night (17 October), and Roseanne Barr was not amused. Barr was infamously fired from the sitcom Roseanne earlier this year after posting racist messages on Twitter, with the show continuing without her under a new name, The Connors. The fate of her character had been kept heavily under wraps by the series’ network ABC and was revealed during the first episode, titled “Keep on Trucking”. At first, the audience are led to believe that she died of a heart attack following knee surgery, until a coroner’s report reveals she died from an opi...

item.title: Informer, episode one review: New BBC terrorism thriller is as nonsensical as Bodyguard - The Independent
item.description:
Informer, episode one review: New BBC terrorism thriller is as nonsensical as Bodyguard  The Independent

It is weird to have Informer (BBC1) on so soon after Bodyguard (BBC1). The two series are so alike that only their mother – or perhaps Auntie – could tell them apart. Where Bodyguard was a six-part thriller about a caring but troubled police officer (Richard Madden) fighting sophisticated terrorists in London, Informer is a six-part thriller about a caring but troubled counter-terrorism officer (Paddy Considine) fighting sophisticated terrorists in London. The obvious defence of the scheduling is that they are to be seen as companion pieces. Rather than close-protection, Informer’s premise ...

item.title: Sherlock season 5 delayed as creators confirm new Dracula series for BBC - The Independent
item.description:
Sherlock season 5 delayed as creators confirm new Dracula series for BBC  The Independent

The creators of Sherlock are officially adapting Dracula for the BBC. As first reported by Variety, Mark Gatiss and Steven Moffat are currently working on a fresh version of Bram Stoker's tale. It'll run for three 90-minute instalments and will be broadcast on Netflix outside of the UK. The series, set in 1897, will revolve around the blood-drinking vampire from Transylvania who targets residents of London. The 25 best TV shows on Netflix UK - 25 show all The 25 best TV shows on Netflix UK - 1/25 Bojack Horseman A cartoon about a talking horse, starring the goofy older brother from Arrested...

item.title: The Walking Dead season 9: Did episode 2 reveal how Maggie will leave the series? - The Independent
item.description:
The Walking Dead season 9: Did episode 2 reveal how Maggie will leave the series?  The Independent

There's a shadow hanging over The Walking Dead season 9 in the form of the forthcoming departures of lead stars Andrew Lincoln and Lauren Cohan. By the time the midseason finale airs in December, both actors will have exited the show although details on what will happen to their characters - Rick Grimes and Maggie Rhee - are currently unclear. While it seems likely that Lincoln is definitively done with the series, a return for Cohan seems more likely - and tonight's episode, titled “The Bridge,” proved just that, One moment sees Maggie taking some much-needed time off from hanging people a...

item.title: South Park labels The Simpsons as racist in Brett Kavanaugh episode - The Independent
item.description:
South Park labels The Simpsons as racist in Brett Kavanaugh episode  The Independent

South Park has taken aim at The Simpsons in its latest episode, which saw Brett Kavanaugh referenced in the form of famous character, Mr Hankey. Despite maintaining a respectful relationship with its animated rival throughout its 22 seasons, creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone removed the gloves for the latest episode 'The Problem with a Poo' - a play on the title of the documentary The Problem with Apu which detailed how the long-running character, voiced by white actor Hank Azaria, was used as a device to bully stand-up comedian Hari Kondabolu when growing up in New York. The Simpsons was...

item.title: Ozark season 3: Netflix renew Jason Bateman-starring series - The Independent
item.description:
Ozark season 3: Netflix renew Jason Bateman-starring series  The Independent

Netflix has renewed the Jason Bateman-starring series Ozark for a third season. The streaming service has confirmed that the third series will consist of 10 episodes, the same as the first two seasons. Centred on a former accountant who becomes entwined with a dangerous drug cartel, the series has quickly become a favourite among critics and viewers, with one survey finding that the show was the Netflix’s most-watched title during the summer of 2017. A release date for season three has not been announced, but considering season one arrived 21 July, 2017, and season 2 following on 31 August,...
